px3pbegwsL-0v-mmveJF-g.text: Wish I had known earlier that a lovely lunch place like this existed in Holborn.  On my last lunch date I went to hummus bros! Anyway I had "toast and rainbow trout" (the trout was almost like guacamole but was delicious) and a ceasar salad which to be honest wasn't quite as good (chicken was a bit slimy, for want of a better description). I think both were around £10. My dining companion had a steak melt sandwich which was apparently very tasty but arrived, slightly comically, on a tiny plate with no garnish or accompaniment. This reads like a 3 star "a-ok" review rather than 4, but I liked the busy ambience and nice surroundings and if you maybe choose carefully and ask a few questions of the waiter you will be fine.

hHpTYS_-iGe1NpD3GtXfFg.text: This recently opened restaurant in the back of the Hoxton hotel has a trendy atmosphere with matching staff outfits and allows a peak at the food being prepared in the open kitchen. The open plan setting means things get a little noisy when it is busy. The food is an amazing twist on classic dishes with fresh ingredients. I would really recommended cured meats and the oxtail toast as starter, the duck (nice and pink) as main and the key lime pie dessert. Cocktails are similar classic twists and the homemade lemonade was a hit too! Highly recommended!

yaFOgh5hlQ13WAHrxM9jDA.text: One of my favorite hang out spots in the city.  I've yet to stay in one of their - no doubt - gorgeous, cosy rooms, but I can't get enough of the bar/cafe area here.   With large windows, numerous comfy sofas and arm chairs to relax in and a well stocked bar it's a real surprise how I ever manage to leave this place. For those with a sweet tooth, the cakes (try the Apple Strudle Cheescake) from Hubbard & Bell are to die for - so delicious, you'll want to put yourself into a sugar coma trying every single one. The coffee is well served too - being such a coffee snob, this is a real big sell for me.

peXxVxZzJsBrxz4NZFwZaQ.text: Came to Hubbard & Bell on a Saturday night around 8pm and (to my surprise) the place was emptier than I thought it'd be... Though the Hoxton itself was packed. Since I had done my Yelp research prior to visiting, I noticed that there weren't many mentions about dinner here... So maybe their strength is brunch and people just go for cocktails at night? Idk. My group had made a reservation anyways and were seated immediately. Anyways, I ordered the following things:- Kale Caesar: I'd kale for this Caesar ;) I was in the mood for something a bit lighter but couldn't decide between this and the linguine, so I ordered a small portion of both. Why not have the best of both worlds, right? The Caesar was probably my favorite dish of the night. Not too overdressed but not underdressed and bland, the kale was prepared properly and wasn't bitter (I'm assuming they massaged it prior to serving too because it wasn't harsh and tough), and the egg on top was cooked a perfect medium rare haha. They also give you a hefty amount of chicken, so you can definitely order a regular sized portion and get full off of it- Linguine: their linguine was fairly unique in my opinion. For starters, it's pretttttty spicy so beware if you've got a low spice tolerance!! The dish had a squid ink linguine base, and was tossed with a decent amount of crab, seaweed, and nduja. There was a decent amount of crab, which made the dish fairly fishy. I personally liked it since it tasted like the sea, but my friend was super turned off by it and didnt finish hers. The seaweed was a creative inclusion as I'd never had a combination like that before, but it added to the "taste of the sea" theme the dish had going on, and it made the dish more refreshing (since pasta can get a bit heavy sometimes imo). As for the nduja, I didn't really taste it. It might have been why the dish was so spicy, but I almost forgot it was there until I had reread the menu. My friends also ordered the Pork Belly and Gnudi. I unfortunately can't comment on the taste of either since I didn't try them myself, but based off appearances... The Gnudi seemed to be a fairly small portion, but it looked good! The sauce seemed rich and creamy, and the pasta looked fresh. The pork belly on the other hand is something I'd go back just to try. The skin looked oh so crispy (pork crackling is one of my weaknesses in life) and they give you two sizable pieces! Overall, dinner at H&B was better than I expected, and I'll definitely be back to try their brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Hubbard & Bell - London, United Kingdom. Small portion of the linguine
Photo of Hubbard & Bell - London, United Kingdom. Kale Caesar

V33EVGzw67vgHKLbZ2-_Tg.text: Really like this place! Cutest little cafe in the new Hoxton Hotel in Holborn. Love taking clients here for a little brekkie. Lovely decor! Gorgeous toilets! And very friendly staff, always! Normal I always have the avocado on toast with poached egg - always lovely, much better offering than in most places because at least they give you lots of avocado! Crumbled pistachios is a nice touch too. This time though I wanted eggs florentine! The obssession has come back!! Its not on the menu, but as they seemed to have all the elements in different dishes I though id be cheeky and ask! No problem at all! Which is kind of predictable but still nice! They were lovely. One of the eggs wasnt runny though, which obviously is a little dissapointing but overall good dish.Highlight at Hubbard & Bell has to be the juices!!! Awesome offering of really flavoursome cold pressee juices! In a little bottle too, so you can always grab another bottle to go! Had a try at the Red one today which was great. Highly recommend Hard Green too! But i am adament they are all great!

photos.caption: Photo of Hubbard & Bell - London, United Kingdom. Cheeky Hard Green Juice to go!
Photo of Hubbard & Bell - London, United Kingdom. Eggs florentine! Not on the menu but they are more than happy to do it for you!

q_5X8J_ok7BAt2yR8txQGw.text: Awesome beet root salad!!! The (Bavette) hangar steak and sauce were exactly as I requested. Comfortable industrial design dining area with electrical outlets for phone charging for travelers. Staff is very happy.. But bring a small bit of patience, they are not in a hurry but neither was I.

photos.caption: Photo of Hubbard & Bell - London, United Kingdom. Beet Root Salad with Avocado and pumpkin seeds.

S3ODeI1EOCjJzNk_NKhEZA.text: Just the right about of busy on a Saturday night! Between Dinner and Friends I was looking for a quick cocktail in Holborn, and having had great experiences in the Hoxton in Shoreditch, it would have been rude not to check out the younger sibling while in the area,It was a Saturday night, nice level of activity around the bar, good tunes from the DJ and a nice relaxed easy going vide, we settled for a few seats at the bar, and despite it being busy, we where acknowledge straight off and given menus, it was great to see the bar staff actively serve customers in order, refreshing to see in a busy bar!We ordered a few cocktails from the list, and it watched as the bar tender set up constructing our order, drinks we got in the end where perfectly served, and so so good! But for the fact we where off to meet people elsewhere I could have quite happily propped the bar up here all night long!Will be back for sure next time I'm in London!

photos.caption: Photo of Hubbard & Bell - London, United Kingdom

lDOn2R5nCQlOL-VwoUyE7Q.text: A cool brunch place!! Been here twice now and on both occasions had good food. The first time we shared some eggs which were well prepared and satisfying and a really tasty ceased salad which looked amazing but left me a little hungry (I guess it was salad?!?!) one complaint would be on the occasion we went as a group of 6 we were only served 5 pieces of bread.... I also got beef ribs when I ordered pork, but it was actually really good.The venue is very open and has a separate  bar area that I hear can get busy after work days, especially on Fridays. It has a feeling of a hotel about the place, and I think there are rooms available to stay in.There are loads of staff so getting served isnt a problem and they all seem knowledgable about the menu and friendlyThere is a good selection of coffees also. .

photos.caption: Photo of Hubbard & Bell - London, United Kingdom

aldl0NHc4nbQM0a2gRWOhg.text: We stayed at the Hoxton and although we had the complementary yoghurt and granola pot, banana and OJ, I wanted much more! As soon as I saw steak and eggs on the menu, I couldn't get downstairs fast enough.Being mid week and between Christmas and new year, the restaurant was quiet. Being around 11am I justified having the steak and eggs for brunch. I also ordered some hash browns but they already come with it YES! James ordered the avocado and eggs on toast with a side of bacon. The portions are great! The steak and eggs were not a disappointment. Nice hunk of fillet steak on 2 lovely hash browns topped with poached eggs, spinach and hollandaise YUM! If red meat wasn't so bad for you I would have this everyday for breakfast. I managed to nab a bit of James's breakfast too. The avocado and eggs on toast was delicious and the side of bacon was amazing, thick and perfectly cooked.If I was meeting friends in the area, I would definitely pop back here.

SEGdzbK51HytjvmnZY8Vgg.text: I went to this place specifically while on vacation because it was on symmetry breakfast's Instagram. Super cute place, vintage and homey, rustic and amazing! We ordered the porridge, sticky pecan buns, croissants, and Benedict. The portions are pretty dainty, the Benedict probably should be ordered with potatoes instead of the English muffin on the bottom just to fill you up more, or get avocado on the side. The people are very friendly but we were not able to sit in the restaurant because we didn't have a reservation so we sat on the couches by the barista.

photos.caption: Photo of Hubbard & Bell - London, United Kingdom. Coffee
Photo of Hubbard & Bell - London, United Kingdom. Pecan sticky bun
Photo of Hubbard & Bell - London, United Kingdom. Benedict with avocado added

uA_EOYm8im1G2t7T_58xhw.text: I was extremely disappointed by this place. A bartender told me some guy had paid for my next  drink. An hour later, a different bartender charged me for that second drink. I asked for an explanation, and I was reassured that two parties had not paid for the same drink. It's cool if that's true, but I am not at all convinced that it was. If one bartender asked me to order a drink because someone had already paid for it anyway, why would a different bartender ask me to pay for the exact same drink? If it's not an outright scam, their internal communication is abysmal. I will never return.

vCg_gH0943mp8h67IcB6rw.text: Great restaurant in the vibrant Hoxton hotel. I had the veggie burger and a side of roasted pumpkin, both of which were great. Had a whiskey based cocktail which was well made and decently priced for the area (£9). Will be back to try brunch in the future.

_MN4CN0nxdtLZ61S6SIa9g.text: I came here for their advertised Thanksgiving menu.The atmosphere was lovely but quite loud for a Thursday evening. I started off with a DELICIOUS apple and ginger cocktail that was lovely--though the bartender forgot to make it when he was making drinks ordered by my group and had to be reminded twice before he got around to it. It was quite crowded so I couldn't really fault him but he was rather rude when I finally caught his attention to make the drink I had ordered. Once we sat down for dinner, the waiter was nice but not very attentive (I had to ask for a refill on water 3 times) and the Thanksgiving meal (turkey with cranberry and green beans) was overcooked, over salted and quite tough--in short, not worth the £19 I paid for it. That being said, all of the non-Thanksgiving food I saw at tables around me looked delicious so it could have just been the mistake of ordering off the holiday menu. Also, they were out of pumpkin pie at our 6:30 dinner seating--the main reason for our visit to the restaurant. :'(In the absence of pumpkin pie I had an amaaazing banana split that turned out to be the highlight of my meal.  All in all, I'd head back for cocktails and dessert but mediocre service and my very salty and rathered shriveled main left a bad taste in my mouth.

1QGtIwYCDuVbEO6Vw6_9Mg.text: Great atmosphere and the food is delicious. Such a relaxed vibe loved the avocado toast and the lattes are to die for!

l1AplVGIhSMOVhld6dIUFw.text: While we stayed at the Hoxton Hotel (the Holborn branch), we once had breakfast "downstairs" at the Hubbart & Bell which conforms quite nicely to the hotel's soho-house-like design concept. While this, strictly speaking, is not a hotel restaurant (which I usually try to avoid), it does serve as one of the Hoxton Hotel's local watering (and eating) holes. (There is also am underground chicken place and a coffee bar on the ground floor.) And it does share the tendency of hotel restaurants to ever so slightly overprice the goods on offer.Having said that, the quality of the food was excellent, the waiting staff was nice (although there English wasn't always as good as the food they served) and the overall decor was pleasing in a retro-meets-comfy kind of way. However, I would avoid sitting in the rather noisy and crowded back of the restaurant and instead opt for one of the lower tables near the front.

photos.caption: Photo of Hubbard & Bell - London, United Kingdom. Nice to look at and not too bad - the cappuccino. Alas, it could be served a bit more on the hot side.
Photo of Hubbard & Bell - London, United Kingdom. A bit like Soho House.

gxr1muwXrrCbK4HozNUaxA.text: Been here twice in 3 days. Awesome place to get some work done for those location independent entrepreneurs like myself or any sort of work. You do have to scope out the seats you want for a bit though but you'll generally find a cozy spot. Food is excellent. Service is awesome. Vibe and energy is great. Roomy, spacious yet comfortable. Must place to hang out vs the typical Starbucks. Oh and their green juice is refreshingly delicious.

c1NnqiqRq7a6P0IWj0cAIQ.text: Came for lunch on a Saturday. Packed with tourists and twenty somethings. Nice atmosphere, relaxed but a little buzzy. Seemed to be sharing tables bit i was shown to a nice two seater table. No steaks. Healthy lunch. Had the blood orange salad. Even the large portion is small but its v nice. Juicy blood orange and crispy fennel with a red wine vinaigrette v nice. Salmon was cooked perfectly med rare with a crisp skin onion and caper sauce. Was v good but could have had more capers. Side of kale and parsnip was not what i expected. Both were super crisped tasted more like seaweed from ur local Chinese. Was nice and fun. Will return.

aFrAaanZ3rx7Gzfjs7txSA.text: Food was ok. Never paid 23 pb for an eggs Benedict with avocado. Service was not that good as our food sat on the counter and the chef had to tell service three times. So everything was a little cold. And when we had gotten there, there were only Maybe 6 other guests. Had to keep asking for more water. Good not worth the price I paid.

h5kt6BpUjoADq9S5L6dpHw.text: I am very happy about Hubbard & Bell. Food is pretty good and offers a very delicious burger for lunch and dinner, while you can munch on pancakes, bagel with salmon and eggs benedict in the morning. Everything works well and service is so nice. Everyone serves us happily, they are smiling and are very attentive. Last, but no least: This place is so beautifully designed.

AR9IoATGq2YYiEGUy0ADvg.text: Just finished brunch at Hubbard & Bell. Now, while I ran a half marathon this morning, then walked from Kings Cross, the food and coffee Kylie and I ordered was delicious. We shared the steak and eggs (which is eggs florentine on a hashbrown, with two decent sized pieces of superbly cooked steak throw in for good measure) and the patty melt sandwich and fries. We also had a flat white, home brew and finished it all off with a cold brew. Note: Don't wear a light denim blue shirt tucked into dark trousers. You will be confused for waiting staff, which were very polite and attentive.

wSs04xYaP1ZcjbizIQ0Mig.text: Great breakfast! I had the QUINOA PORRIDGE with almond milk, banana and bee pollen. It was delicious. Atmosphere and service are also high quality. Cocktails for after work drinks are great and the ambience is worth it.

5bGFvXlHIHeH_LmTrdH3yA.text: Trendy spot in the Hoxton Hotel. I've had a few of their dishes and found the salads, mains and toasts really nice. Good spot for eating with a larger group, rather than a spot for couples.

h_w0U4oj9iZSkpYk5BWtkQ.text: Nice place to relaxinghas lots of seatsand really do has amazing breakfastThe omelette is the best with the smoked salmon sides

photos.caption: Photo of Hubbard & Bell - London, United Kingdom

AO13S0jocGVro2sH_IDlWQ.text: My first several experiences were decent.  The food is pretty average by the atmosphere is nice.  Tonight though, I had a terrible experience with the manager.H&B has a wonderful program where you can register for a token that gives you half off a drink & entree for you & (one person said 9 other, one said 7) other people.  I've used it several times & it takes their overpriced food down to a regular price (so is it really a discount?).This time however, the manager accused us of cheating & trying to abuse the system & refused to grant us the discount.  We had ordered assuming the bill would be half off, & we're stuck paying twice as much as we had intended.  The waitress was apologetic about it, but there was nothing she could do.  Not sure I'll be back.

7BD2TM4ozledSxWB-Lx3rA.text: Came here late night for a bite to eat and a dessert. Spot on menu with a good drinks and dessert selection. Sat in the comfy booths in the dining area but you can also eat in the bar and lounge area with couches. Steven ordered a patty melt which is simple yet delicious and French fries. Becca had the ricotta toast with tomatoes and broccoli...so good! Dessert----key lime pie and a buttered pecan brownie...amazing! Really great vibe overall and many options including a coffee shop. Also recommend staying in the Hoxton Holborn hotel above. We loved having this restaurant on the ground level.

photos.caption: Photo of Hubbard & Bell - London, United Kingdom. Dessert! Key lime pie on left and buttered pecan brownie.

PL_qEsNgbhmWhSl7wYxvqg.text: Considering how highly I regard this hotel's bar, I was so so surprised how awful the experience of eating in their restauarant was. Super overpriced, terrible service and surreptitiously given and charged for bottled water (my absolute pet peeve). I found the burger to be outrageously priced, so opted for two side dishes instead, and even then found the soup to be tasteless and too small for the cost. I had always thought the menu sounded pretty boring, but held faith as everything else about the Hoxton (where this restaurant resides) is so top notch I gave it chance. Turns out my initial gut feeling was correct. Skip it.

R11vBMlviiY_xGzWhTsbNA.text: I went here recently with a friend on a busy Friday night. It was busy and very noisy, annoyingly we were sat right by the DJ, which was really loud.  On arrival, I was a little earlier than my friend, I was greeted and seated by the hostess who was very friendly and nice. I also was asked if I wanted to make a drink order before my friend arrived and I ordered a cocktail which was very nice. The waitress told me I'd have to start a tab which I thought a little odd. When my friend arrived, we ordered drinks and our meals. The waitress was friendly and sweet but her English wasn't great and she kept asking us to repeat everything and any questions we had, she kept having to go and check so maybe she was new. The food - we both ordered burgers - was nice and plentiful. Our desserts were nice but very sweet and my friend's salted pretzel cheesecake was very rich and she had to leave lots of it. My sundae was lovely but very sickly sweet. Overall it was okay but not amazing and I'm sure the location is better for the bar and drinks. Great location in the heart of Holborn.

W_Mpyvs82tJKG5kH182U0g.text: Sweet little spot to duck in for a snack, lunch or tea. You can see the sweets of the day on display at the tea/coffee/juice counter. We tried the beer and avocado salad- no lettuce included, and sprinkled with seeds - it was really yummy. The truffle Parmesan fries were also flavorful, a little on the greasy side and smaller fractured pieces. They were willing to put the Parmesan on the side for us (thanks). With the aromatic English Breakfast tea, we tried the Christmas cookies (filled w/ seeds and grapes) and mini-mince pies- also nice. Servive was good- they were right on top of cleaning plates when we finished something. Comfortable, airy space.

photos.caption: Photo of Hubbard & Bell - London, United Kingdom. Nice open space

3fjaPzXD-5w-xJ7fFb4TDw.text: AMAZING food! every time I visit from America I eat here breakfast, lunch, dinner, or coffee it's always top notch! I strongly advise this place!

jwlMtD0MpeZmTt-Dxp-rGw.text: Beautiful space inside the Hoxton, love the laid back vibe and decor. Stopped in for brunch one day, and thought the food was very nice. I went for the kale caesar salad, which was tasty, and some chia pudding, also very good. The rest of the menu looked very nice also, especially their breakfast. Unfortunately, the service was VERY slow (it was very busy), which put a damper on it. I was starving by the time the food came.

HlOFuYK88W6ix-eiaA4cyQ.text: First breakfast while in London and we weren't disappointed, we had the avocado and eggs, just amazing! Staff were so friendly and very welcoming as soon as walking in the doors. Wasn't too overpriced, you pay for what you get! Very happy and would return!!

3Dl-BbAp2kXJnuA8bk49ag.text: This place was all I wanted it to be, and more! Real fresh food, great Coffee, awesome service & lovely surroundings. When I'll go back to LDN I'll definitly be returbiljett to this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Hubbard & Bell - London, United Kingdom. The equiptment said it all about this place. Great grinders give great results. Can't wait to come back here!
Photo of Hubbard & Bell - London, United Kingdom. Beautiful machine and social, kind barista. Coffee from Workshop, tasted amazing!
Photo of Hubbard & Bell - London, United Kingdom. Great Eggs! Local produce is always a big plus for me!

4_RXxFFAER2fEmU9IiZXwA.text: Nice breakfast place with bad service. The menu is not bad but the staff is so distracted they bring the tea after you finish your omlette or they forget the maple syrup with pancakes! It is breakfast for god sakes! You bring the tea and you never forget maple syrup with pancakes. But prices are decent, it is comfortable so try is you dont like small places.

8bag4JMlfUPZ7uHsfRMTYg.text: A delightful place to enjoy breakfast. I loved them so much that I should have made another visit. Oh well my lost, I  guess that I will have to make sure I come back again! Thumbs up for their Gluten-free breakfast. I would  encourage the cook to be light on toasting the bread, other then that I believe the service was good.

7pHDt4dRSB5Gxt7plx1EBg.text: Looks good, great lounge atmosphere, reliable Wi-Fi. However, there are almost no vegan gluten-free options at all. And the pastries are pretty bad and unhealthy. I cannot comment on the restaurant itself, as I haven't tried it.

o1TMTeA4JSwk2CsdQ2i7xg.text: Great brunch place ! The Sunday Feast is amazing :For 25£ you get access to a great range of food from cheese, charcuterie, salads, fish preparation (crab, salmon and more...), sausage and meat... To great deserts, fruits salads and yoghurt! Great for the feasters!The menu is also nice the avocado and pistachios toast showed in the picture is very generous and tasty. Cocktails and smoothies are also good... Definitely a place to discover

photos.caption: Photo of Hubbard & Bell - London, United Kingdom. Cappuccino
Photo of Hubbard & Bell - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hubbard & Bell - London, United Kingdom. Desert feast

L0LFNUX4KeHG3Yp4wvhE2w.text: I'm really surprised I haven't heard more about Hubbard and Bell, came here on my last day wandering around London on recommendation from a friend. This cafe is so cozy and warming. I love the atmosphere and the service.

photos.caption: Photo of Hubbard & Bell - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hubbard & Bell - London, United Kingdom

uwvWonAVrkMRm1nCRIuWJw.text: Excellent place to get breakfast, lunch or just drinks. Their coffees - the flat whites, lattes or expressos are probably among the best I've had so far. They really take their coffee seriously.  Their sourdough pancakes and quinoa porridge are very awesome breakfast items -filling and just right to start your day off. I had a falafel burger for lunch - this was fantastic!  Highly recommended to order with French fries and aoli. Their drinks are pretty good as well. Their Picante De La Casa is really good and highly recommended. They also have a good selection of single malts as well. I will be back when I come to London next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Hubbard & Bell - London, United Kingdom. Quinoa porridge
Photo of Hubbard & Bell - London, United Kingdom. Latte with Indonesian Expresspo - fantastic!

E8k-iTK8LQ0ECP4zcZhNkA.text: We're here for Christmas Day dinner. We had a table for 18:00. We arrived early and was seated early. When we were seated we were told the kitchen wasn't taking orders until 18:00, which was fine with us. We ordered and dinner at 18:00 came out at 19:15. Of course we noticed that everyone who had ordered their dinner after us had already started eating. The manager came to our table to say he was sorry that our food was coming out soon. So he offered us another cocktail which was nice of him. But that took another 20 mins to come out. It just sat on the bar waiting for someone to bring it to us. Not sure this experience was worth the hassle and or the meal. The feeling of the place is like a Starbucks. You know the guy working on his computer in a chair next to you and people across from you sharing a cocktail table having dinner as they sit on sofa's.

jCST9pYXyQpSB8uqib4MdA.text: Dope spot to stay (Hoxton Hotel) and get your food on.The brunch (American ish) has caught on, over here, and this is a spot to get your steak n eggs or roll with what I got, avocado with poached egg on a piece of toast (deeelish).The fresh-squeezed juices and strong but tasty coffee are great day-starters.As for the decor, obv, it was redic awesome.  Who doesn't love cozy settings with sofas and the traditional London vibe?  Not so much Victorian as urban-rustic.  Dope.Ask for the Bloody Mary. Its bloody cheeky, mate.Gospel of Paul.

1yA5S6lasCGF_9UCA9rxUw.text: I'd read some reviews of Hubbard & Bell (and the Hoxton more generally) before heading there for dinner.  The general conclusion was: great attention to detail, great design...just ok food.I'm here just to serve as an additional voice in that chorus: yes to detail, unhunh to design, and yet - and yet! - disappointment regarding food.The good: the service was really prompt, the food came out quickly, and although some things felt overpriced (the shrimp burger - actually a mix of shrimp and crab on a bun that disintegrates as you eat it - is 10 pounds for just the burger), if you choose wisely I think you can get some good dishes.  I was impressed by their take on the wedge salad, for instance: a crispy, refreshing chunk of iceberg lettuce topped with some chunky buttermilk dressing and paired with some sweetly cured bacon.  Notable expert level: fat perfectly rendered.  It was a thing of beauty.  Atop the food, the design details are on point.  Beautiful seating options and varying arrangements across the Hoxton.  Food served on mismatched china plates that ooze charm.  Plugs at every booth should you need to stay wired.  No feelings of being rushed, despite visiting at a peak time.  Yes yes nailed it, yes.The not-as-good: the food wasn't piping hot, and whereas some dishes provided ample to chow down on (see note on wedge salad, above), others were really sparse.  Our table split the ricotta toast (with broad beans and chili) and it was extremely underwhelming; what read so well on the menu just tasted bland and dry on the plate.  Maybe that's a good metaphor for my feelings on Hubbard & Bell generally.In conclusion: go, get the bacon, get all the bacon.  I'd be willing to try it again because I adore the space, and the staff was great.  But...in no rush.  Hopefully by the next round at Hubbard & Bell they will have worked out some of their kinks with the food.Yelp note: just for drinks?  Sure!  Or pull up your newest Apple gear and sit down next to the table of Mac-heads pounding the keys at the communal tables.

8lWQ50JPfXl-1SHbWBF7xw.text: Popped in for a quick pre theatre meal on Saturday, lovely place for catching up over some food and wine.We were in the mood for burgers; my friend had the veggie version which was great, I had the patty melt, which was unusual in presentation but spot on in taste. Our sides were a mixed bag - the fries were good but the creamed spinach disappointed - soggy, cold in spots, and poor consistency.To accompany our meal we shared a bottle of the Grenache rosé - lovely wine, perfect for the sunny weather we are enjoying!For pudding I chose the s'mores sundae. It was fine, but a little dull if anything - it lacked the flair of a good sundae when it came to finish. It was ice cream and stuff in a sundae dish - tasty but not a show stopping sundae by any means! My companion had the cheese plate which was very good; generous wedges of cheese, pleasant accompaniments, and lots of different breads and crackers on the side. The service from our main waitress and the gentleman supervising the room was excellent - that perfect balance where you're attended to beautifully, but can also carry on conversations uninterrupted! Another waitress tried to clear our plates while we were still eating, which was a little odd, but you can't fault the enthusiasm.I enjoyed my meal at Hubbard and Bell - when looking at the menu several other items caught my eye, as did the £25 brunch deal on Sundays and several tempting looking cocktails. A good Holborn spot.
